summary: This is an email exchange between a prosecutor (AUSA) and another party regarding the Epstein case. The sender requests to speak with the recipient before contacting a victim, and copies two Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) working on the case.

persons.name: Ori Inal
persons.context: Appears to be the sender of the original email, requesting to speak with the recipient before talking to a victim in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 30, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
The correspondence involves coordination between legal officials regarding contact with a victim in the Epstein case.
Two Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) are copied on the email, indicating ongoing prosecutorial work on the case.
The sender emphasizes the need to speak with the recipient before contacting the victim, suggesting careful witness/victim management.
The document reference 'EFTA00101253' suggests it is part of the Epstein-related document releases.
